item.title: Data Interpolation with Radial Basis Functions (RBFs)
item.description: Radial Basis Functions (RBFs) is one of the commonly used methods to interpolate multi-dimensional data. RBFs creates smooth and less oscillating interpolation than inverse distance weighting (IDW) does. It has many applications in Computer Graphics, such as surface reconstruction [3], animation blending [1], facial retargeting, color calibration [4], and etc. Despite of the variety of its applications, those applications all have a common theme called scattered data interpolation.
